parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 1st Person Singular
str2: From hupo and stello; to withhold under, i.e. to cower or shrink, to conceal.
To bring back word, report; I announce, declare. From ana and the base of aggelos; to announce.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Neuter Plural
str2: From sun and phero; to bear together, i.e. to collect, or to conduce; especially advantage.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
To teach, direct, admonish. A prolonged form of a primary verb dao; to teach.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Public, publicly. From demos; public; in public.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
A dwelling; by implication, a family.
